channel.title: So the past week
channel.description:
When I wasn't on here being a complete moron, I was down south on my grandma's property getting pumpkins planted for this Fall, Planted around 30mounds give or take, Then I walked out and a dog dug up at least 10 mounds. Also I been feeding our goats various things to see if they like it. Also I grabbed onto the billygoats horns and shook em around and made him run after the gulf cart I was driving, and nearly crashed into a tree not watching where I was going, while driving from him.
So it was a fun week not counting the dogs messing up the plants, but still. Have any of you guys every planted crops?(Not on an online game either..) Or taking care of farm animals, or anything of the sort.

item.title: So the past week
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

Used to have a few lambs and goats here, oh and a donkey. That was when i was really young and it was fun with them being around.

Now i’m left with only a cat.

Only thing we’re growing is cucumbers and beans or whatever they’re called.

Read full topic

item.title: So the past week
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

No never the only remotely natural experience I’ve ever had was a 7 day “hike” through a forest which wasn’t even tiring at all.

Read full topic

item.title: So the past week
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“SETO, post:15, topic:398900”]80% of my life lived in a farm…had goats,cows,chicken,horses, and other random animals…never had pigs tho
we did alot of farming… mainly tabaco,onions,spinach (that grew with the tabaco’s) and other things.

country life > city life[/quote]You haven’t experienced much without the pigs. Makes the farm smell entirely different.

Read full topic

country life > city life

inb4farmville

I like goat cheese.
